Arman Khan I am a second-year B.Tech engineering student with a passion for front-end development. My academic journey has equipped me with a strong foundation in computer science principles, and my personal projects have allowed me to dive deep into the world of web development.

Hobbies

Listen music

Listening to music can be a deeply enjoyable and relaxing hobby. It involves exploring different genres, artists, and songs to find what resonates with you. This hobby can be pursued in various ways, such as attending live concerts, creating playlists, or simply enjoying your favorite tunes at home. Listening to music can also have numerous benefits, including stress relief, improved mood, and even enhanced cognitive function.

design and develop

Design and development encompass a range of activities related to creating visual and functional products. As a hobby, this might involve: 1.Graphic Design: Creating visual content like posters, logos, and social media graphics using tools like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or Canva. 2.Web Design: Designing the layout and visual appearance of websites. 3.Web Development: Writing code to build websites or web applications, typically using languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React or Angular. 4.UI/UX Design: Designing user interfaces and user experiences for digital products to ensure they are intuitive and user-friendly.

photography

Photography is one of my favorite hobbies. I love capturing moments and scenes through the lens. It’s amazing how a single photo can tell a whole story or evoke different emotions. Whether it's landscapes, portraits, or just everyday life, there’s always something new to discover and capture.

Skills

75%

Photoshop

Photoshop is a powerful and widely-used software for image editing and graphic design. It's a raster graphics editor developed by Adobe Inc. and is used by photographers, designers, and artists to create, edit, and manipulate digital images.

70%

Illustrator

Illustrator is a leading vector graphics software used by designers and artists to create scalable graphics. Unlike raster graphics, which are made up of pixels, vector graphics are composed of paths defined by mathematical equations, allowing them to be resized without loss of quality.

85%

Front-End

front end" in web development refers to the part of a website or web application that users interact with directly. It's everything that users see and experience in their web browser, including the layout, design, and user interface elements.
